Bodhisattva Tivara rose from his seat, adjusted his robes, put his palms together, knelt for a long time, and praised the Buddha, saying:
The secular does not reach the clarity of the Way, acting as the basis for the world, already transcending the myriad obscurations, now taking refuge in the one who delivers the world.

By means of giving, upholding the ten powers, already subduing one's own mind and transforming others, this is the one who delivers all without not being served, now taking refuge in the one in the three realms who is unequaled.

With appearance, there is nothing that is not beneficial. Its light is red like gold, its sound is harmonious, and its color is extremely beautiful, unsurpassed by anyone. Now I take refuge in the one who is not served by anyone.

With liberation, it liberates and subdues various non-Buddhist paths. Its wisdom is extremely revered, above the crowd of the wise, and cannot be moved by anyone. It fully knows all practices, and its merits and virtues are extremely revered. Now I take refuge in the great compassion that is limitless.
In all desires, there is nothing to be attained. The various demons have sought it, but none can match it.
Its pure precepts are not at ease with anything. Among all gods, it is the god among gods. Its mind is no longer attached to anything. Now I take refuge in the one who is unsurpassed.
Hearing its virtues, there is no one who is not delighted.
Its form is like a treasure, and there is no one who sees it without loving it.
Having given, free from desire, anger, and delusion, I now take refuge in his virtue, which is like the heavens, covering all without exception.

With the four truths, he surpasses the four entrances, and with the eyeless, all can see and understand. The Dharma he speaks has no bounds, and in the three periods of time, he is the basis for all. I now take refuge in his feet, which have the wheel.
His body is served by all the heavens and humans, without male or female, all can rely on him.
The many demons do not dare to confront him, and he is the most honored in the heavens above and below.
With the many truths and correct Dharma, he upholds all. His mind is equal and compassionate, pervading everywhere.
He is the guide for all, and his Dharma abides equally. I now take refuge in his virtue, which is unsurpassed.
His voice is soft and pure, and those who hear it are delighted.
His voice is like Brahma, reaching everywhere.
All sounds are complete, now I take refuge in the Honored One.
Already crossed over emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, that wisdom is extremely profound and unattainable.
The faculties have already entered the liberation of the assembly, this is the merit, now I take refuge in the one who has already attained liberation.

Fully knowing the merit of what is born from causes and conditions, that which is seen is without inside or outside, because of equality, that which is known is separate from suchness, now I have already taken refuge in transcending all that can be seen.
Also without coming from anywhere, without going from anywhere, viewing all dharmas as completely liberated, like an illusion or a mirage, now I take refuge in the merit of the Dharma.
What is born is without birth, both are without birth;

The Buddha said:
Bodhisattvas use four things to be self-mastered.
